intro: Himantoglossum hircinum var. caprinum, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. It has palmate leaves with a hairy texture and is often found in mountain meadows and scree slopes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in many areas.
